page.title: 14EDUCATION IN LOUGHBOROUGH
page.content: {Holywell School}is built on land that was part of th Garendon Estate and near to the site of a Holy Well. It was opened in l968 to serve a housing development on the south side of Loughborough. Its shape is based on a honeycomb and each classroom and other study areas are of a hexagonal shape linked to each other. Children aged 4 to 11 years attend the school in classes of about thirty children. 352 children attend school. { Charnwood Hall} is used by the Education Authority to provide boarding accommodation for boys over 11 years who attend school in Loughborough. At{Longcliffe Hall}35 students attending Loughborough University live in self_catering accommodation with a communal recreation room.
